BackstoryDef.title: orbital farmhand
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up maintaining hydroponic bays on a crowded orbital station. Zero-gravity crop rotations and battling fungal infestations taught [PAWN_objective] plant mastery, but left [PAWN_pronoun] unprepared for terrestrial life.

BackstoryDef.title: glowbelt scavenger
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Raised in the irradiated ruins of a failed arcology, [PAWN_nameDef] learned to harvest salvage from autonomous defense systems still guarding dead tech. Constant radiation exposure left [PAWN_objective] strangely resilient but socially feral.

BackstoryDef.title: corpse hauler’s apprentice
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: After a plague wiped out a frontier colony, [PAWN_nameDef] was put to work stacking bodies for the burn pits. Death became routine, and [PAWN_pronoun] developed a grim practicality that unsettled others.

BackstoryDef.title: refugee caretaker
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Born into a displaced colony fleet, [PAWN_nameDef] grew up tending to the sick and wounded aboard overcrowded ships. With resources scarce and suffering constant, [PAWN_pronoun] learned that kindness was sometimes the only thing left to give.

BackstoryDef.title: battalion foundling
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Orphaned during a planetary campaign, [PAWN_nameDef] was taken in by a roving battalion and raised among hardened soldiers. Between maintenance drills and live-fire exercises, [PAWN_pronoun] learned that survival was earned, not granted.

BackstoryDef.title: deathworlder
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up on a planet where everything alive wanted [PAWN_objective] dead. The trees dripped venom, the insects burrowed into flesh, and predators struck from the shadows. \nCompared to that, this world's fauna looks tame.

BackstoryDef.title: deathworlder
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up in a land where everything had fangs, venom, or a nasty temper. The small creatures were often worse than the big ones—a bite from the wrong spider could stop a heart, and even a careless brush against the local wildlife could mean days of agony. The rivers hid ambush hunters, the skies carried winged nightmares, and the ground itself swarmed with things that stung, bit, or strangled. \nSurvival meant constant vigilance, and [PAWN_nameDef] learned that lesson young.

BackstoryDef.title: desert nomad
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was born beneath an unforgiving sun, where the only shade came from makeshift tents or the hulks of long-dead machines. \nSandstorms could tear flesh from bone, the heat could scorch the unwary, and water was worth more than life itself.

BackstoryDef.title: voidborn
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was not born on a world, but instead on a vast ship in the depths of space. [PAWN_possessive] family lived in a flotilla of deep-space vessels, moving between colonies and trading hubs. \n[PAWN_pronoun] grew up surrounded by machinery, artificial gravity, and the void beyond windows. At night, when [PAWN_pronoun] can see the stars, [PAWN_pronoun] feels closer to home.

BackstoryDef.title: iceworlder
BackstoryDef.description: Ice worlds have a way of passing their chill on to those who live there, and [PAWN_nameDef] was no exception. From an early age, the brutal cold of [PAWN_possessive] homeworld's endless wasteland shaped [PAWN_objective]. \nAs soon as [PAWN_pronoun] could walk, [PAWN_pronoun] was learning to adapt—bundling up in insulated layers, keeping the settlement’s energy systems running, and mastering the art of survival in a frozen hellscape. [PAWN_possessive] earliest lessons didn’t come from books, but from the harshness of nature.

BackstoryDef.title: penal world
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was born on a penal world, raised in the margins of a society built on punishment and forced labor. There were no schools nor playgrounds—only fences, bunkhouses, and watchtowers. [PAWN_pronoun] learned from older denizens how to fight, how to steal, and how to keep [PAWN_possessive] head down when it mattered. \nOn worlds like that, innocence didn’t last long.

BackstoryDef.title: slum dweller
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up in the slums, where every day was a struggle to get by. Food was scarce, work was harder to find, and trust was a luxury no one could afford. \n[PAWN_pronoun] learned to navigate the streets by being quick, resourceful, and always watching for danger.

BackstoryDef.title: indebted child
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was born on a world where citizens inherit debt the moment they take their first breath. [PAWN_possessive] parents knew no honest work would ever pay it off in time to spare their child from a childhood of forced labor. \nInstead, they entrusted [PAWN_objective] to an offworld trader—an old friend with no family of his own. [PAWN_nameDef] learned the truth in adolescence: that [PAWN_pronoun] would never see [PAWN_possessive] birth parents again. By law, they had given away property that was never legally theirs. \nIt was a truth that scarred [PAWN_objective] deeply. To this day, [PAWN_pronoun] struggles to make peace with the act of love that saved [PAWN_objective]—a sacrifice made by strangers [PAWN_pronoun] never got to know.

BackstoryDef.title: Waterworld
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was born aboard a salt-crusted barge, one of hundreds chained together in the endless drift. [PAWN_pronoun] grew up among rusted catwalks and humming pipes, patching hull fractures with weldpaste and coaxing crops from hydroponic beds lit by growlights. \nWhat lingered most, though, were the rare glimpses of life beneath the waves—offering a quiet sense of instinct, of purpose, older than language and beyond the need for words.

BackstoryDef.title: observer
BackstoryDef.description:
Most children moved together, spoke alike, and thought alike. [PAWN_nameDef] noticed this early. It wasn’t that [PAWN_pronoun] felt special; [PAWN_pronoun] simply couldn’t join the rhythm. Everyone else moved like a herd, while [PAWN_pronoun] was always set apart. 
One morning, [PAWN_possessive] mother—extravagant and unfiltered—remarked at breakfast, “Some people never left the age of robots.” It was merely a passing metaphor about conformity, not meant to be taken literally. Yet [PAWN_nameDef] absorbed it completely and began to see people as literal robots. 
Over time, [PAWN_possessive] view grew less literal, though the metaphor’s impact remained. Seeing others as 'robots' became a lens—a way to process [PAWN_possessive] alienation. It was never about superiority, just a method to understand [PAWN_possessive] distance. 
In that borrowed metaphor, [PAWN_pronoun] found both comfort and a reason to remain apart—a casual phrase, spoken without intent, that would shape the very architecture of life in a child’s mind.
